trans-unit.source: Set and retrieve Properties and Metadata for Storage Resources | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set and retrieve Properties and Metadata for Storage Resources | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set and retrieve properties and metadata for Azure Storage resources.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set and retrieve properties and metadata for Azure Storage resources.

trans-unit.source: Set and Retrieve Properties and Metadata
trans-unit.target: Set and Retrieve Properties and Metadata

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Objects in Azure Storage support system properties and user-defined metadata, in addition to the data they contain:
trans-unit.target: Objects in Azure Storage support system properties and user-defined metadata, in addition to the data they contain:

trans-unit.source: System properties.
trans-unit.target: System properties.

trans-unit.source: System properties exist on each storage resource.
trans-unit.target: System properties exist on each storage resource.

trans-unit.source: Some of them can be read or set, while others are read-only.
trans-unit.target: Some of them can be read or set, while others are read-only.

trans-unit.source: Under the covers, some system properties correspond to certain standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: Under the covers, some system properties correspond to certain standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: The Azure storage client library maintains these for you.
trans-unit.target: The Azure storage client library maintains these for you.

trans-unit.source: User-defined metadata.
trans-unit.target: User-defined metadata.

trans-unit.source: User-defined metadata is metadata that you specify on a given resource, in the form of a name-value pair.
trans-unit.target: User-defined metadata is metadata that you specify on a given resource, in the form of a name-value pair.

trans-unit.source: You can use metadata to store additional values with a storage resource; these values are for your own purposes only and do not affect how the resource behaves.
trans-unit.target: You can use metadata to store additional values with a storage resource; these values are for your own purposes only and do not affect how the resource behaves.

trans-unit.source: Setting and Retrieving Properties
trans-unit.target: Setting and Retrieving Properties

trans-unit.source: Retrieving property and metadata values for a storage resource is a two-step process.
trans-unit.target: Retrieving property and metadata values for a storage resource is a two-step process.

trans-unit.source: Before you can read these values, you must explicitly fetch them by calling either the **FetchAttributes** or **FetchAttributesAsync** method.
trans-unit.target: Before you can read these values, you must explicitly fetch them by calling either the **FetchAttributes** or **FetchAttributesAsync** method.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Property and metadata values for a storage resource are not populated unless you call one of the **FetchAttributes** methods.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Property and metadata values for a storage resource are not populated unless you call one of the **FetchAttributes** methods.

trans-unit.source: To set properties on a blob, specify the property value, then call the **SetProperties** or **SetPropertiesAsync** method.
trans-unit.target: To set properties on a blob, specify the property value, then call the **SetProperties** or **SetPropertiesAsync** method.

trans-unit.source: The following code example creates a container and writes property values to a console window:
trans-unit.target: The following code example creates a container and writes property values to a console window:

trans-unit.source: Setting and Retrieving Metadata
trans-unit.target: Setting and Retrieving Metadata

trans-unit.source: You can specify metadata as one or more name-value pairs on a blob or container resource.
trans-unit.target: You can specify metadata as one or more name-value pairs on a blob or container resource.

trans-unit.source: To set metadata, add name-value pairs to the **Metadata** collection on the resource, then call the **SetMetadata** method to save the values to the service.
trans-unit.target: To set metadata, add name-value pairs to the **Metadata** collection on the resource, then call the **SetMetadata** method to save the values to the service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]: The name of your metadata must conform to the naming conventions for C# identifiers.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]: The name of your metadata must conform to the naming conventions for C# identifiers.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve metadata, call the **FetchAttributes** method on your blob or container to populate the **Metadata** collection, then read the values.
trans-unit.target: To retrieve metadata, call the **FetchAttributes** method on your blob or container to populate the **Metadata** collection, then read the values.

trans-unit.source: The following code example creates a new container and sets metadata for it, then reads the metadata values back out:
trans-unit.target: The following code example creates a new container and sets metadata for it, then reads the metadata values back out:
